entities.description: The raw number of responses for each category.
The percentage of total responses for each category.
Different responses available for a given question in the NSDUH survey.
Types of measurement units used for quantifying substances (e.g., gram, kilogram, ounce, etc.).
The measure of a specific substance in various units.
The number of total valid responses recorded for the surveys.
Statistics like mean, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation for responses.
Special codes used to represent missing, unknown, or invalid data.
A table representing the frequency of each response category.
The type of data variable (e.g., numeric).
Instructions for analyzing the response categories in different statistical packages.

relationships.description: A survey has a frequency table detailing response frequencies and percentages.
A frequency table contains various response categories.
A response category has an associated unweighted frequency.
A response category has an associated percentage.
Substance measurement is expressed in different measurement units.
The survey statistics include summaries of the number of valid cases.
The survey provides statistical measures such as mean, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation.
The survey uses special codes to indicate missing, unknown, or invalid data.
Each substance measurement has a corresponding variable type.
The survey includes instructions for response analysis in different statistical packages.
